snippet: Opponents of affirmative action were jubilant on Election Day when California voters handily passed a citizens' initiative, Proposition 209, that banned all programs involving race  and sex preferences run by the state.    Conversely, affirmative ...
lead_paragraph: Opponents of affirmative action were jubilant on Election Day when California voters handily passed a citizens' initiative, Proposition 209, that banned all programs involving race and sex preferences run by the state. Conversely, affirmative action proponents were distraught.
abstract: Opponents of affirmative action were jubilant on Election Day when California voters passed Proposition 209, which bans all programs involving race and sex preferences run by state; Federal court ruling on Nov 27, citing 'strong probability' that proposition is unconstitutional, has effectively blocked implementation of measure in California and sown confusion among supporters of similar initiatives around country (M)

headline.main: Affirmative Action Battle Moves to Courts
